name: Lad Khan Temple
description: A Chalukyan era temple dedicated to Shiva, known for its intricate carvings.

name: Halasuru Someshwara Temple
description: A small but significant Shiva temple with a unique pyramidal roof.

name: Bhoganandeeshwara Temple
description: A pre-Chalukyan era temple with a unique stepped pyramid tower (Vimana).

name: Shiva Temple, Bhumara
description: A Gupta era temple with exquisite carvings and one of the oldest surviving Ganesha idols.

name: Lingaraj Temple
description: A massive Shiva temple, one of the oldest and largest in Bhubaneswar, known for its intricate Kalinga architecture.

name: Vaishno Devi Mandir
description: A cave shrine dedicated to Durga, a popular pilgrimage site with a mysterious origin.

name: Kailashnath Temple
description: A monolithic rock-cut temple dedicated to Shiva, one of the largest such structures in the world.

name: Shore Temple
description: A group of Pallava era temples, including a shore temple dedicated to Shiva, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Thiruvaragunamangai Perumal Temple
description: A Vishnu temple known for its early Dravidian architecture and sprawling complex.

name: Brihadisvara Temple (Big Temple)
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, a massive Chola era

name: Meenakshi Temple
description: A vast and colorful Dravidian temple complex dedicated to Parvati (Shakti).

name: Jagannath Temple
description: A major Hindu pilgrimage site dedicated to Krishna, Balarama, and Subhadra.

name: Rameshwaram Temple
description: A pilgrimage site dedicated to Shiva, with long corridors and a Ramanathaswamy temple complex.

name: Virupaksha Temple
description: A group of temples dedicated to Shiva on the banks of the Tungabhadra River, part of the Vijayanagara empire's ruins.

name: Konark Sun Temple
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, once a grand sun chariot temple dedicated to Surya, now partially ruined.

name: Mundeshwari Devi Temple
description: An octagonal shaped temple dedicated to Devi Mundeshwari and Shiva, considered one of the oldest functional temples in India.
image: [Image Search: Mundeshwari Devi Temple, Kaimur district]

name: Mukteshwar Temple
description: A Pallava era temple known for its intricate carvings and dedication to Vishnu.

name: Kedareshwar Temple
description: A Shiva temple located in the Himalayas, one of the Chota Char Dham pilgrimage sites.

name: Mahabodhi Temple
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, one of the holiest Buddhist sites marking the place where Buddha attained enlightenment.

name: Dhanushkodi Temple
description: A ruined temple dedicated to Rama, believed to be submerged in the sea due to mythological events.

name: Hazratbal Shrine
description: A revered Muslim shrine housing a holy relic of Prophet Muhammad's hair.

name: Khajuraho Temples
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, a group of Hindu and Jain temples known for their intricate carvings and erotic sculptures.

name: Jagatpita Brahma Mandir
description: A rare temple dedicated to Lord Brahma, the creator god in Hinduism.

name: Tungnath Temple
description: The highest Shiva temple in the world, located in the Himalayas, part of the Panch Kedar pilgrimage.

name: Mahabalipuram Caves
description: A group of rock-cut cave temples with sculptures depicting Hindu mythology, including the Varaha Cave.

name: Martand Sun Temple
description: Ruins of an ancient Sun temple with unique architectural features, showcasing Greco-Roman influences.

name: Adi Kumbeshwarar Temple
description: A Shiva temple known for its intricate architecture and one of the five grand temples of Shiva in Kumbakonam.

name: Chennakesava Temple
description: A Hoysala era temple dedicated to Vishnu, known for its elaborate carvings and star-shaped plan.

name: Rani ki Vav (Queen's Stepwell)
description: A unique seven-story stepwell intricately carved with religious and secular figures, showcasing Maru-Gujarat architecture.

name: Kandariya Mahadeva Temple
description: One of the most well-preserved temples in the Khajuraho group, dedicated to Shiva and known for its intricate carvings.

name: Lingaparvata Temple
description: An ancient Buddhist stupa with Greco-Roman architectural influences, potentially one of the oldest surviving Buddhist monuments in India.

name: Belum Caves
date_built: Natural caves, with Hindu temples built inside during the Gupta period (4th-6th century CE)
description: A network of natural caves with speleothems (cave formations) and Hindu temples dedicated to various deities.

name: Sun Temple, Modhera
description: A ruined Sun temple showcasing Maru-Gurjar architecture, with a large reservoir and intricately carved gateway.

name: Govind Devji Temple
description: A vibrant Hindu temple dedicated to Krishna, known for its colorful paintings and devotional atmosphere.

name: Jama Masjid
description: One of the largest mosques in India, built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan, known for its red sandstone and architectural grandeur.

name: Golden Temple (Harmandir Sahib)
description: The holiest shrine for Sikhs, a gilded spiritual and cultural center with a serene pool and a rich history.

name: Weerabhadra Temple
description: A Vijayanagara era temple with a unique monolithic pillar balancing on its edge and intricate carvings depicting various mythological stories.

name: Bahubali Gommateshwara
description: A colossal Jain statue of Gommateshwara, the largest monolithic statue in India, carved out of pink granite.

name: Meenakshi Devi Temple
description: A North Indian temple dedicated to Parvati (Shakti), known for its intricate carvings and unique architectural style.

name: Mundeshwari Temple
description: An ancient temple dedicated to Shiva and Shakti, believed to be one of the oldest temples in Chhattisgarh.

name: Trimbakeshwar Shiva Temple
description: A Jyotirlinga temple dedicated to Shiva, located at the source of the Godavari River, a holy site for Hindus.

name: Koneshwaram Temple
description: A shore temple dedicated to Shiva, part of the Mamallapuram group of monuments, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Vitthoba Temple, Pandharpur
description: A major pilgrimage site dedicated to Vitthoba, a form of Krishna, known for its annual pilgrimage festival (Yatra).

name: Rani Mahal
description: A palace complex with a temple dedicated to Lakshmi, the goddess of prosperity, showcasing Mughal architecture.

name: Dakshineswar Kali Temple
description: A temple dedicated to Kali, a fierce aspect of Parvati, known for its riverside location and vibrant atmosphere.

name: Jagannath Temple, Puri (Ratnagiri)
description: A smaller temple dedicated to Jagannath within the Puri temple complex, known for its intricate carvings and unique Ratnagiri style.

name: Vaikom Mahadeva Temple
description: A Shiva temple known for its elephant processions during festivals, a unique tradition in Kerala.

name: Annapurna Temple
description: A temple dedicated to Annapurna, the goddess of food and nourishment, located near the Ganges River in Varanasi.
